titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Corporation, Board of Trustees, Finance Committee, Minutes
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Corporation, Board of Trustees, Finance Committee, Minutes FA1017

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-26 11:37:05 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Corporation, Board of Trustees, Finance Committee, Minutes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for scholarly research.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Box 1 is arranged chronologically by code number. Box 2 is arraned chronologically by date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of signed records of actions taken in regard to financial transactions and securities bought and sold by the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research.
Starting with June 4, 1959 Minutes are mimeograph copies, much more detailed and not signed (archive copies are not originals).

Included in Box 1 is a report made February 21, 1941 by Squires & Company to the Finance Committee on "Revision of Basis for carrying the Investments on the books of account at cost or other original basis".

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: As established by the By-Laws of 1911, the Finance Committee consisted of three elected members of the Board of Trustees to have power, subject to the regulations and limitations of the Board to make and change investments. This Committee was deemed to be in continuous session and joint action of two members was binding. Regular minutes of actions were to be kept and formal reports to be made at regular meetings of the Board.

Over the years various ammendments were made to the Rules for this Committee clarifying policies governing investments. The Treasurer of the Corporation (as of 1926) was to act as Secretary of the Committee and have custody of the Minutes and other papers and documents relating to its work. The Assistant Treasurer was to act as Assistant Secretary of the Committee.

The reorganization of 1953 left the Finance Committee at three elected members to advise the Board of Trustees and Treasurer on investments and financial policy and other powers and responsibilities as conferred by the Board of Trustees. The size of the Committee was amended in 1962 to no less than three and no more than five elected members.
